record.description: President Robert M. Hutchins greets winners of Two-Year-Honor Scholarships at the University of Chicago. These twenty-five freshmen are part of a group of thirty-four who have received special scholarships valued at $600. The awards, like the "Rhodes Scholarship," are based on intelligence, personality, leadership, and health. First row, left to right: Wayne Rapp, Long Beach, California; Harold Wegner, LaPorte, Indiana; Leland Boggs, Savannah, Georgia; Benjamin Ragir, Grand Rapids, Michigan; Robert Maynard Hutchins; Harry Hall, Chicago, Illinois; Alvin Pitcher, Downers Grove, Illinois; Stephen B. Straske, Fremont, Michigan; second row: Clayton Mattson, Detroit, Michigan; Wallace Dyer, Chicago Heights, Illinois; Eugene Patrick, Ironwood, Michigan; Franklin Carr, Kansas City, Missouri; Theodore Miles, Omaha, Nebraska; Hobart Gunning, Princeton, Illinois; William Cliff, Algoma, Iowa; Paul Kuhn, Terre Haute, Indiana; third row: Gerald Johnson, Chicago, Illinois; William Fill, Kansas City, Missouri; Clarence Cade, Oak Park, Ill.; Howard Marks, Sullivan, Ind.; Jesse Beitel, San Antonio, Texas; Wesley Neff, Streeter, Illinois; Harry Brown, LaGrange, Illinois; Vincent Newman, Topeka, Kansas; Warren Askew, Tulsa, Oklahoma; John Horn, Highland Park, Illinois.
